thread.title: N.J. woman's missing dog returns home after six months
thread.title_full: N.J. woman's missing dog returns home after six months

author: Mari A. Schaefer
title: N.J. woman's missing dog returns home after six months
text:
N.J. woman's missing dog returns home after six months Updated: March 14, 2017 — 4:34 PM EDT 98 Share 
Mari A. Schaefer works for the Inquirer. More by Mari A. Schaefer Arrow icon 
A New Jersey dog is home safe after disappearing six months ago. 
Paris, a 1-year-old Maltese belonging to Tanya D. Flowers, bolted from her Jersey City apartment on Gardner Avenue in September. A witness reported seeing a man pick up the pup and drive off, NJ.com reported. 
At the time, Flowers spent hours handing out fliers and contacting shelters, to no avail. 
About a week ago, she got the call she had hoped for when a shelter in Staten Island, N.Y., let her know it had her missing dog. 
"I really thought my dog was gone forever," Flowers told the website. "I also wasn't sure if this was a joke or not because I had received numerous prank phone calls from the fliers I had put up." 
The dog was reportedly found in North Bergen four months ago by a man who took her in. When he could no longer care for her, he took Paris to his mother's home in Staten Island, N.Y. She then took the dog to a vet, who discovered a microchip, Flowers told the website. 
"When I walked up to the door in Staten Island and saw my dog, I just started screaming," Flowers said, adding that Paris immediately began barking and licking her face. Published: March 14, 2017 — 1:47 PM EDT | Updated: March 14, 2017 — 4:34 PM EDT Do you have a minute?...
